message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the factors that affect the spiciness of peppers. When peppers are exposed to heat, their capsaicin levels (the compound responsible for their spiciness) increase, making them hotter. Option (A) is irrelevant and not related to the spiciness of the pepper. Option (B) is incorrect because freezing peppers does not affect their spiciness. Option (D) is also unrelated, as the act of eating the pepper does not change its spiciness.
